update.description:
There are some compilation errors with gazebo_1.8 when used with the latest versions of certain dependencies, as discussed in #657.

The change to World.hh involves removal of a variable that we weren't using and allows compilation with the latest protobuf.

The changes to Param.hh and QTestFixture.hh are related to a qt bug ([QTBUG-22829](https://bugreports.qt-project.org/browse/QTBUG-22829)), which involves the moc compiler failing if certain boost headers are included (`boost/lexical_cast.hpp` and `boost/program_options.hpp` definitely cause the problem with boost 1.53 and qt4). The fix involves wrapping `#include` tags in an #ifdef. Since it is a QT bug, one approach is to wrap all includes in files that get parsed by moc (should be limited to `gazebo/gui/*`).

Rather than a blanket approach, I managed to fix compilation by wrapping two include statements, one of which is in `sdf/interface/Param.hh`. This file shouldn't have to worry about a QT bug, but it is much simpler to make the change here than in the many files in `gazebo/gui/`.
update.title: Fix compilation errors with latest protobuf and QTBUG-22829 (part fix of #657)
